fields.description: In the Plan Audit log, the list of audit events can grow quite long, and paginated across numerous pages, is difficult to examine for changes. It would be nice if there was an "Export" feature available on the Actions menu that would dump the plan audit log data into a CSV file so that it could be imported into Excel for sorting and filtering.
fields.summary: Plan Audit Log - Export to CSV/Excel

fields.description:
Timestamps are now hard coded as 12 hour days, it should be possible to choose 24 hour days. 

As a bonus, it should be possible to choose between relative and absolute timestamps in the dashboard page.
fields.summary: Configuration option for preferred timestamp

fields.description:
A full administrator (which is only Atlassian Support in Bamboo OnDemand) has the ability to add new executables to the list of available executables in the Command task. Restricted administrators (i.e. customer admins) do not have this ability.

Considering restricted admins can use elastic custom images, it seems that they should have the flexibility to add their own executables here.
fields.summary: Allow restricted administrators to add executables in the custom 'Command' task

fields.description:
Hi,

I've run my build and it seems it's successful. It should produce artifacts like https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/PERFENG-CONFCUSTOMA-27/artifact , but https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/PERFENG-CONFCUSTOMA-28/artifact and https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/PERFENG-CONFCUSTOMA-29/artifact have no artifacts.

Can you show the reason why there's no artifact, whether the cause is they've been deleted, couldn't be saved for lack of space or couldn't be found?

How it should be:
!Build27.png|thumbnail!

How it is:
!Build29.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Test scenario:
- using hal9000 create full OnDemand instance
- in JIRA create empty dashboard, try to add gadget (Bamboo gadgets are displayed)
- using hal9000 restart instance
- use your empty dashboard and try to add gadget (Bamboo gadgets are not displayed)

Observed on fireball-187
fields.summary: JBAM plugin does not provide gadget list after OnDemand instance restart

fields.description:
This problem was detected in the Bamboo integration with HipChat. I've already checked with the Bamboo team and they confirmed that the issue in in the HC side.

Example:
In Bamboo the user full name is "Tobiás Csenák".
When the full name is sent to HipChat, the notification is displayed with "Tobi Csen" as the user full name.

The special character and the next characters are truncated.
fields.summary: Characters with accents are truncated from user names

fields.description: When we release a particular version in JIRA, we have the option to trigger a build in Bamboo. It will be  great feature to link all issues associated with the released version to Bamboo build for tracking purposes. At the moment, we can only view the issues from JIRA release notes.
fields.summary: Auto link issues of released versions to the associated builds in Bamboo

fields.description:
We should add a special note to notify users that if they are using JIRA or crowd for user management, the URL of the Bamboo server might change and as such the Bamboo application in JIRA/CROWD will have to be edited as well to reflect the new URL. 

doco: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Cloning+a+Bamboo+instance
fields.summary: Add a note about user management on the cloning server documentation

fields.description: It would be great to have incremental build possibility using Maven in Bamboo plans. Similar feature in Jenkins works using '-pl projects_list' and '-amd' switches to Maven invocation after discovering 'projects_list' by changes from SCM. I personally believe it's a good way of doing it and not so hard to implement. From the UI perspective, it's just one checkbox.
fields.summary: Incremental builds with Maven

fields.summary: we are getting the following system Errors in our bamboo box - Please help us resolve this issue
Allow default commit filtering to be editable

fields.description:
A request for the results of one specific build returns the wrong URL to the build log:

$ curl -X GET http://server:8085/rest/api/latest/result/TEST-TEST-42.json?expand=stages.stage.results.result.artifacts |json_pp |grep 'href.*log'

"href" : "http://server:8085/download/TEST-TEST-JOB1-42/build_logs/TEST-TEST-JOB1-42.log"

This URL 404s; the correct URL (as given by the Bamboo UI) should be:

http://server:8085/download/TEST-TEST-JOB1/build_logs/TEST-TEST-JOB1-42.log
fields.summary: REST API returns wrong log URL

fields.description: I can have a link to latest stable build summary (https://jira.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/VP-VPSTABLE/latestSuccessful) but I would like to be able to provide similar link to the artifacts page of such build - so QA's can pick the latest successful artifact for their tests
fields.summary: Linkable "latest stable artifacts" page

fields.description:
Currently, Bamboo Bulk operations allows Admins to update the [Web Repository URL|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Modifying+Multiple+%28Bulk%29+Plans#ModifyingMultiple%28Bulk%29Plans-weburl] only.

It would be good if the Admin could update all the Perforce repository fields.
fields.summary: Allow Admins to Bulk change Perforce repository details

fields.description: If the Scheduled Backups Events are implemented in BAM-12460, it would be very useful if System Notifications were implemented to send notifications that catch events like ScheduledBackupPassedEvent and ScheduledBackupFailedEvent as mentioned in BAM-12460
fields.summary: Implement Scheduled Backup Notifications

fields.description:
If the Scheduled Backups are enabled, when the backup actually fires it would be very useful if it threw Events when the backup succeeded and in the case where it fails such as a ScheduledBackupPassedEvent and ScheduledBackupFailedEvent.

This would then allow Notifications to be created for these events so that Admins could receive emails if the backups failed.
fields.summary: Implement Scheduled Backup Events

fields.description:
Testing customizations to the default windows 64bit image ( ami-976edafe ) shows that it is taking about 5 minutes for the agent to boot up; plus the time to boot up the instance makes loading Windows agents to take 8-10 minutes.

A linux agent is generally available in ~1min. Please improve the loading process for Windows instances.

By the way, trying to fasten the process by using this script (c:\opt\bamboo-elastic-agent\bin\prepareInstanceForSaving.bat), as it is described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Creating+a+custom+elastic+image+-+Windows], doesn't make any difference.
fields.summary: Windows EC2 instances load too slow
Can't add IM address to notifications in format user@servername

fields.description: If an artifact is generated that is essentially a directory of files, it would be nice to be able to get a link to download a zip of that artifact's contents. This would save someone from having to SSH/SCP artifacts from the physical machine Bamboo runs on.
fields.summary: Add download link for whole artifact

fields.description:
If I were to go to the artifacts tab for a specific task in a build -- say, bamboo.example.com/browse/MYBUILD-MYTASK-47/artifacts -- I would get something like the following: 
{quote} Job Artifacts are accessible on server under:
/import/j2ee/domains/path/to/MYBUILD/MYTASK/build-00047
{quote}

If I go to just the build artifacts tab -- bamboo.example.com/browse/MYBUILD-47/artifacts -- it tells me nothing.

It would be nice to see a list of the output directories for each task on the build's artifacts tab.
fields.summary: List artifact output directories on root build artifact page
Fix GIT url examples in Bamboo documentation

fields.description:
Currently if I want to have a wallboard for all plans and branches in a project, I need to load two separate Bamboo wallboard pages:

* {{telemetry.action?filter=project&projectKey=<key>}} for the non-branch plans in the project
* {{telemetry.action?planKey=<key2>&filter=showPlanAndBranches}} for the branch builds within a single plan

This is manageable for now with only a single plan containing branches, but it won't scale.

Is it possible to get a wallboard mode that combines the two? Perhaps with a branch icon indicator on the relevant builds, too.
fields.summary: Allow wallboard for a project to also show plan branches

fields.description:
Add a task for MSDeploy (used to deploy ASP.NET web apps).

Command line syntax for msdeploy: http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd569106(v=ws.10).aspx
fields.summary: MSDeploy task for Bamboo .NET support

fields.description:
Some customers may want the plan trigger to be every X hours, but all detected branches (or manually added branches) to default to manual.

If this was available then they would only need 1 plan for periodic running of the build and also for manually running feature branches with the same configuration. Currently they have to maintain multiple almost identical plans, or every X hours all branches will spin up builds.
fields.summary: Allow to configure a default trigger for all branches from the plan

fields.description: I have added labels to the branch builds of several projects.  On the All Plans dashboard I click the filter button.  I can see the label I added, but selecting it yields 0 results.
fields.summary: Dashboard filtering by plan label returns 0 results

Instead I would expect the standard "Access Denied" page you get when you try to access a Plan or page you do not have permissions to.
fields.summary: All Build RSS Feed Throws 'Internal Server Error' Instead of 'Access Denied' for Plan I Have No Permissions To.

fields.description:
I have a Plan FOO, with failed build #3. User2 has NO permissions to the Plan, not even VIEW. If I am logged into Bamboo as User2 and paste this URL into my browser : 

/ajax/tracking/addUserDialog.action?planResultKey=AVIATIONWSA-RELEASE-3&trackingId=4

I get a page that looks like the attached screenshot. If I click the 2nd Add button the browser submits the page and displays an HTTP 404. However, if I log out of Bamboo and log back in as User1 and go to my Plan FOO and build result #3 I can see that user2 was able to successfully assign them self as responsible even though they have no permissions on the project.

This is similar to BAM-11669 but in that ticket User2 had VIEW permissions to the Plan. In this case User2 had NO permissions to the Plan.
fields.summary: User with NO Permissions to a Plan Can Assign Responsibility

fields.description: As User1 if I have View permissions to plan FOO and set that Plan as a Favourite, it is visible on the My Bamboo page. If for whatever reason my permissions to Plan FOO get completely removed, I can still see the Plan under My Favourites in the My Bamboo page. If I intend to un-favourite it I click the gold star next to the plan listing and get the typical "Access Denied" page stating I do not have permissions to the Plan. Is there any other mechanism a user can use to un-favourite Plans they no longer have permissions to? Perhaps the Plan Admin can see a page of everyone who has Favourited the Plan and turn them off if appropriate.
fields.summary: Unable to Remove a Plan as a Favourite Once I No Longer have Permissions to the Plan

fields.description:
I have a plan FOO where I added User2 with VIEW permissions. The user set the Plan FOO as a Favourite. I then remove the user so they have NO permissions on plan FOO. I logged out, logged in as User2 and went to My Bamboo page. The Plan FOO was listed in the My Favourites section of the page. 

To keep the security model of Bamboo consistent (meaning the Plan/build result is not listed anywhere else in the tool unless you have VIEW permissions) then the My Favourites section should only show the Plan if the User has VIEW permissions.
fields.summary: My Favourites Section of 'My Bamboo' Page Does Not Respect View Permissions

fields.description:
I have a plan (FOO) with only 1 user allowed access (no Anon access or All User access at all). I run a build (#3). It fails. I go to assign responsibility and assign User2. User2 has no permissions on the plan and especially does not have View permissions. 

If I log into Bamboo as User2 I do not see any plans listed (es expected). Then off the dashboard I click My Bamboo, and on the My Bamboo page there is a section called 'My Broken Plans' where it should display the plans where the user is assigned responsibility. The FOO plan with build #3 is listed, even though the user does not even have VIEW permission on that Plan. 

I understand this may sort of be a feature, but the security model needs to be consistent, in that if a user without VIEW permissions cannot view the plan/build on the dashboard or elsewhere, then they should NOT be able to view it anywhere else, including the 'My Broken Plans' section.
fields.summary: 'My Broken Plans' Section of 'My Bamboo' Page Does Not Respect View Permissions

fields.description: presently we have the feature to create reports. It will  be nice to have a new feature that can allow us save the reports and subscribe to them for regular emails.
fields.summary: Provide email subscriptions to reports

fields.description: When a Plan is created, it defaults to to having Anon and All Users have View permissions. This is probably fine for small teams, but in many behind-the-firewall installations this is the opposite behavior. Other than the user creating the plan, no one should have default permissions, not even view. Since I can see both behaviors useful to different kinds of users, I would suggest creating a setting somewhere in the Admin section (General Config, etc) that lets you check a box as to whether or not Anon or All Users gets default View permissions on any new plan.
fields.summary: Provide Admin Setting That Controls Plan Permissions Default Values

fields.description:
Our [Viewing a job's Maven dependencies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Viewing+a+job%27s+Maven+dependencies] page contain a screen shot, however the dependencies sections are empty.

Would be good to allow the docs to display how exactly we show the dependencies.

fields.description:
I got my rememberme token by logging in with a valid username and password.

The intent of captcha is to stop brute-force attacks on a password. When I have a rememebrme token, this is *not* what I'm doing and I should therefore be allowed to log in.
fields.summary: Valid rememberme should be used even when captcha count is high

fields.description:
On the Plan dashboard (/browse/PROJKEY-PLANKEY/) I press the L key which is supposed to be a shortcut to open the Labels window popup. The popup opens fine. The title of the popup is Plan Labels. I then click the Close link on the popup window and instead of closing as expected the popup window flashes suddenly but stays on the screen. The title of the popup window now simply says "Labels" instead of "Plan Labels". If I click the close link a 2nd time the window finally closes.

This same behavior occurs in Firefox 16, Safari 5.1, and Internet Explorer 8. 

Note : I did not report this to Support as I am not running Bamboo 4.3 in production and am only doing local testing.
fields.summary: Plan Labels Popup ShortCut Not Working As Expected

NUnit 3.0 is nearing its v3 release and bamboo has no support for running the tests. The xml output of nunit 3 has been change quite drastically to support many new features. The goal of this ticket is to add support for nunit 2.9.5+ in bamboo.

fields.description:
After upgrading our installation of Bamboo to 4.3.1, I'm finding a number of plan branches which no longer have the expected contents of bamboo variables.

To work around deficiencies in previous versions of Bamboo, the source repository in these plans reads:

  https://svnhost/svnpath/project/${bamboo.repoprepend}${bamboo.branch}

Our usual project layout is:

  project/trunk    <- main development
  project/branches/X.Y.Z   <- particular branch

In order to have the same plan be able to build the trunk and the branches, the plans were set up with the 'repoprepend' variable set to 'branches/'.  The only branch in each plan to override this variable was the 'HEAD' branch, which set 'repoprepend' to '' and 'branch' to 'trunk'.

After the migration, all the 'HEAD' branches failed, because Bamboo was unable to construct a valid svn path.  Configuring the Branch and trying to add the Branch override of the 'repoprepend' variable to '' or anything else resulted in a message:

  This Plan already contains a variable named repoprepend

Smart Bamboo, there is already a variable named 'repoprepend'.  But you're not listing it in the branch variable listing, and not letting me override it.  You're also referring to the 'Plan' instead of the 'Branch'.  No cookie for you.

The only cure is more cowbell.  Wait, that's not it. Deleting the branch and recreate it, with 'repoprepend' containing '' works, but that gets tiresome to do through the UI.

Please do the Right Thing in properly migrating Bamboo variables with empty strings.  And fix that error message to refer to 'Branch' instead of 'Plan'.

*Workaround*
A workaround to this bug if you don`t intend to have a variable with empty values is to update via the database using the command below:
{code:sql}
update variable_definition set variable_value="some values" where variable_key = "name_of_variable";
{code}
You will need to restart Bamboo for the changes to take effect. Also remember to take a backup before running any command on your database.
fields.summary: Bamboo migration to 4.3.1 doesn't like empty variables
Ship Bamboo with AccessLogFilter set to INFO instead of DEBUG mode

fields.summary: Provide the feature to arbitrary clean working directory

fields.description:
As test-suites increase in size and more and more tests are run (in our case PHPUnit) it would be nice to see where the total amount of time is going towards. Having to scroll through several pages (>1500 tests and growing) can be quite tedious. 

Being able to sort through the tests from a build via reporting (to see the tests over time) or just filtering tests that take an X-amount of time would greatly increase monitoring processes that make up the builds
fields.summary: Filter run tests that took a specified amount of time

Suggestion: We should improve the storage of tests so that larger metadata, such as stdout/stderr are stored on the file system.

fields.description:
When we run a build we store the variables values together with the build result. The problem starts if the given Bamboo instance contains much global variables, in which case the  VARIABLE_CONTEXT will be flooded. Here is a sample from a users instance

|| ||#of plans||#of Builds||#of rows in VARIABLE_CONTEXT table|
|Bamboo instance1|65311|1327308|191 mln|
|Bamboo instance2|536|85538|7 mln|
|Bamboo instance3|748|484344|15 mln|

The above values are most likely if he has ~ 60 global variables.
fields.summary: Improve on the disproportionate growth of the VARIABLE_CONTEXT table on busy instances

fields.description:
Currently, the templates do have a date/time formating set which can be customized (Dashboard "Completed" column and OnHover event for each Plan). However, once the Ajax Auto-Refresh is run the new format is replaced with the traditional one.

This means that the new Ajax date/time format is hard-coded in the Server, not in the template.
fields.summary: Allow Dashboard date/time to be "completely" changed via the page templates

fields.summary: Improve log messages reported when atlassian-user.xml is not complete

fields.description: In Bamboo I have added over 1000 unique labels to different a single plan (by copy-pasting a space-delimited list of valid 4-letter Scrabble words into the add/edit Label box for a Plan and also a Build Result. When I view the Plan or the Build result the extremely long list of words appears fine, but takes up a lot of screen space. I'm not sure of a valid use case as to why someone would need 1000 different labels on a single Plan or a Build Result. It might make sense to cap it at some reasonable limit.
fields.summary: Limit a Maximum Number of Plan and Build Result Labels

fields.description:
In Bamboo I can go to /build/label/viewLabels.action?orderByRank=false

and the text on the page says it is supposed to show ALL labels used in Bamboo. I have added over 1000 unique labels to different plans (by pasting a space-delimited list of valid 4-letter Scrabble words into the add/edit Label box for a Plan and also a Build Result. When I view the Plan or the Build result the extremely long list of words appears fine, but on the View ALL Labels page I mentioned above it only displays approx 200 labels or so.

See attached screenshots. The first shows the 'view all labels' page with only approx 200 or so labels in the tag cloud. The second screenshot shows a build result with hundreds and hundreds of labels, though several hundred more labels are cut off in the screenshot.
fields.summary: Only the first 200 labels for a Plan are displayed

fields.description:
Since Bamboo 4.3, the new Trigger screen while editing a Plan can provide you the ability to add multiple Triggers. I added one trigger (single daily build with a short description). I then added a second trigger and for the description added a really lengthy description without spaces or breaks and was able to save it. It really makes the UI confusing when I go back and select the first Trigger. Not sure how, but perhaps the Trigger screen can use CSS to hide the overflow of the description text if it goes too wide.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Plan Trigger Screen - Trigger Reason Description Can Overrun the Screen

fields.description:
For a plan's build result, I go to edit labels for the build result and in the popup window for adding/editing labels I can add standard labels like "gold", "silver" "foo" "test" etc etc. I noticed however that there does not seem to be any validation on preventing obnoxiously long labels. I was able to add a label that was over 1,000 continuous characters. Though this worked it makes the build result UI start to look weird. However, when I added a Label that was 20,000 continuous characters, it DID add the label but when I go to click the X in the far right of that Label's badge it does not delete and the Firefox  browser throws a Javascript error "No element found". If I close the Label add/edit popup window and refresh the build result the really long label is still there.

Perhaps it is a good idea to limit the length of a Label to something reasonable like 100 characters or at least 500 characters
fields.summary: No limit the character length of labels

fields.description: In Bamboo, when Build Expiry is enabled (system wide or at the Plan level), you can specify to expire builds by time or by number of builds. It would be very useful to specify an option that says expire all FAILED builds, but not PASSED builds. Also to be able to use this in combination with other build expiry options. For example we would like to be able to expire all FAILED builds every 30 days. This is especially handy when large artifacts are generated on failed builds. With this feature you could specify every week or every few days all FAILED builds get expired and thus their artifacts and the disk space they use get cleaned up. We have had multiple internal teams using Bamboo request this ability to expire ONLY failed builds.
fields.summary: Build Expiry Enhancement - Delete Builds/Artifacts By FAILED builds vs. PASSED builds.

fields.description: In Bamboo, when Build Expiry is enabled, you can specify to expire builds by time or by number of builds. From an administrative perspective it would be VERY useful to have an option to expire by artifact size. For example we have teams that have generated numerous artifacts, some ranging from 500 MB to 1 GB per artifact across dozens or hundreds of builds. With 200+ Plans this can eat up disk space. Though we are using global build expiry and trying to get teams to aggressively expire their own artifacts, it is not always possible. Sometimes disk usage spikes on a given day and to quickly resolve the issue would be useful for an admin to force build expiry to run and specify an option that says 'delete all artifacts greater than 500 MB in size".
fields.summary: Build Expiry Enhancement - Delete By File Size

fields.description:
When some checkouts occur that use JGit we encounter Out Of Memory Exceptions and receive a build failure.

For example:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/BUILDENG-2503

An extra reason for why this is bothersome is because for Windows agents, git as an executable is limited to checkout out files which have a path length of 256 characters or less. Whereas JGit doesn't seem have have the pathlength issue manifest itself.
fields.summary: JGIT runs out of memory

fields.description:
As [discussed on EAC|https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2055898202], while quarantining tests is a great feature, there is potential for abuse that could be better controlled with a couple of enhancements:

# Quarantining could (should?) require text explaining why the test is quarantined so other people will know and can help address it later.  This should not live buried off in the original build; it should belong to the quarantine record so that it can show up in all builds where it is applied.
# It should be possible to time bomb quarantines so that the test failures show up again once the quarantine period has expired.
# It should be possible to limit the number of tests in the quarantine so that there is further motivation to keep them under control.
fields.summary: Features to help keep quarantined tests in check

fields.description:
Since we updated to the latest Bamboo 4.3.1 build 3400, no artifact ist being copied from any agent. All worked with Bamboo 4.1.2, from where we updated.

Local agent disabled, working with remote-agents on mac osx 10.7

fields.description: The only option right now to create a .msi package is from a Script task using something like [Wix|http://wix.tramontana.co.hu/]. It would be great if we could add a field to the UI of the MSbuild task to choose the outcome type.
fields.summary: Add a feature to create a .net msi package using msbuild
Allow nested variables

fields.description:
Nowadays the Bamboo server and the Remote Agents use a single Base URL.

Sometimes our customers need to have two Base URLs, one for the server itself and the other one for the Remote Agents.

The URL to be used by the Remote Agents could be specified as a system property.
fields.summary: Add a system property override for agents URL

fields.description:
The Github REST API v3 requires use of the link header to walk all the pages of a repository list, when this list is large.

The com.atlassian.bamboo.rest.util.RESTCall will need to expose response headers and some sort of iterable wrapper is required to retrieve more than one page.

See [http://developer.github.com/v3/repos/#list-organization-repositories] for the repository call API call and the link attribute information is located at [http://developer.github.com/v3/#pagination].

In my case I only get the first page so I am unable to locate my project repository to perform a build, pretty frustrating..

I would have had a shot at fixing this but it seems to encroach on the core bamboo code, being related to the RESTCall class.

Thanks
fields.summary: Currently the github plugin for bamboo doesn't support large lists of repositories

fields.description:
When running a Bamboo plan that starts a Windows process and manually stopping the plan, the build ends; however, the Windows process that is running the build action is left running. Here is a simple way to reproduce:
# Create a build to run on Windows
# Add a script task with
{noformat}
rem ping waits 1 second between pings
rem this will run for 120 seconds

ping -n 121 127.0.0.1 > nul
{noformat}
# Run the build
#- Notice the PING process running in task manager
# Stop the build
# Notice the PING process continues running until the 120 seconds is up - this is the process that should be killed
fields.summary: Windows process not killed after stop build

fields.description:
At the moment, when users of build variables have to change them or insert them into Bamboo Tasks, they have to have a thorough knowledge of all these variables because we're not displaying any information about these variables at the point of entry. If users want to understand what a particular variable stands for, they have to navigate to the Admin area (for global variables) or into the Plan configuration area (for plan variables) to find out more about them. This rips users out of their current navigation context, and they have to navigate back to the context once they've found it.

It would be MUCH better if we had a type-ahead feature for when users enter the variable names, much like Facebook when you reference another person. It could simply detect that users are typing "bamboo." and then it would show a dropdown with all the available variables which gets narrowed down as they type it. At the same time, once users have selected one of those variables (or even more awesome, when they hover over it), an area close by should show the contents of this variable, and a description of this variable (the addition of which is another JIRA issue somewhere). Users would then be much less error prone, and could also simply click on the variable to understand what it means, and whether that's the right or wrong one.

We know this is a very annoying issue for our own guys (reported by Martin Henderson).

If the type-ahead was too hard, a second-best solution would be a simple link close to a variable entry field that brings up a small popup window with all the available variables and their values and descriptions for an easy, conclusive reference.

fields.description: When an artifact is created with a space in the file name, then the resulting artifact can not be accessed from the UI and a page not found error is returned with the filename concatenated with a plus ( + ). The workaround is to replace the + with %20. Another workaround is to remove the space from the artifact by editing it from the artifact directory located in {{\bamboo-home\artifacts\PROJECTKEY-PLANKEY\JOB1}} subdirectory.
fields.summary: Artifacts with spaces are not accessible from Bamboo
